title: The Green Thumb: Organic Growth with Cow Dung

tasks.task: Participate in organic gardening using cow dung fertilizer
subtasks: Research and learn about the benefits of cow dung fertilizer
Collect or source cow dung
Prepare the fertilizer by composting or treating
Apply the fertilizer to garden soil
Monitor plant growth and soil health

tasks.task: Promote sustainable gardening practices
subtasks: Share knowledge about organic fertilizers on social media
Encourage others to use eco-friendly gardening methods

tasks.task: Improve soil structure
subtasks: Apply the cow dung fertilizer to the garden beds
Water the soil to activate the fertilizer
Observe soil moisture retention and nutrient levels

tasks.task: Stimulate healthy plant growth
subtasks: Plant seeds or seedlings in the fertilized soil
Provide adequate water and care for the plants
Harvest mature plants as per their growing cycle

tasks.task: Contribute to sustainable practices
subtasks: Reduce reliance on chemical fertilizers
Minimize environmental impact through composting
Engage in eco-conscious gardening habits

tasks.task: Manage waste in a productive way
subtasks: Identify cow dung as a resource rather than waste
Incorporate manure into agricultural practices
Educate others on the value of organic waste in gardening

tasks.task: First, the main MAINTASK of organic gardening involves all the subtasks related to using cow dung. Of those, which are physical? Applying the fertilizer (soil preparation and application), monitoring, planting, watering, harvesting, collecting/managing cow dung.

Then, for the MAINTASK of promoting sustainability, some of those aren't physical, like sharing on social media, but if it's about promoting practices in the community, maybe not. So that MAINTASK might be redundant. Similarly, the final MAINTASK about managing waste in a productive way—educating others would be non-physical. Therefore, perhaps to focus only on the tasks that require physical activity related to the main practice.
Participate in organic gardening using cow dung fertilizer

So I think the majority of the required tasks revolve around the garden-related actions. Thus, the list I provided earlier, with the six MAINTASKs under participation in organic gardening, each with their subtasks. That should suffice.
Participate in organic gardening using cow dung fertilizer
subtasks: Research and learn about the benefits of cow dung fertilizer (although maybe that's more mental, but from the user's perspective, maybe considered part of the participation)
Collect or source cow dung
Prepare the fertilizer by composting or treating (which breaks down into composting or treating)
Apply the fertilizer to garden soil
Monitor plant growth

tasks.task: Therefore, the final answer with MAINTASKs and subtasks focusing on these physical actions.

the transcript also mentions "this natural treasure... often overlooked". Maybe there's a task of recognizing the value of cow dung. If we consider that as a subtask under one of the main MAINTASKs. So, perhaps recognizing the value of cow dung as an organic resource. Then that could be part of the "participate in organic gardening" subtasks. So once the user has collected and prepared the fertilizer, they have to recognize its value, but since that's more of a mindset, maybe that's not necessary. Or perhaps under "reduce reliance on chemical fertilizers" (a separate subtask).
"reduce reliance on chemical fertilizers", which is a separate task. But user's main focus seems the process of using cow dung, so maybe I should focus on that.
Participate in organic gardening using cow dung fertilizer, with subtasks on research (but maybe considered part of the overall participation), collect, prepare, apply, monitor, plant, care, harvest.
MAINTASK: Participate in organic gardening using cow dung fertilizer
subtasks: Research and learn about the benefits of cow dung fertilizer
Collect or source cow dung
Prepare the fertilizer by composting or treating
Apply the fertilizer to garden soil
Monitor plant growth and soil health
